title: Discrete Math II Functions and Applications
text:
Chapter 5:

Exercise 5a


Step-1Step-2Step-3


DEFINITIONS
The negation of a statement states the opposite of the given statement.


SOLUTION
(a) The opposite of a statement can be obtained by adding â€œnotâ€ to the given statement. The opposite of Mei having an MP3 player is that Mei does not have an MP3 player.


(a) Mei does not have an MP3 player.




Exercise 5b


Step-1Step-2Step-3


DEFINITIONS
The negation of a statement states the opposite of the given statement.


SOLUTION
(b) The opposite of no pollution in New Jersey is that there is pollution in New Jersey.


(b) There is pollution in New Jersey.




Exercise 5c


Step-1Step-2Step-3


DEFINITIONS
The negation of a statement states the opposite of the given statement.


SOLUTION
(c) The opposite of an equality \((=)\) is a difference \(\text{(â‰ )   2+1 â‰  3 }\)


(c) \(2+1 â‰  3\)




Exercise 5d


Step-1Step-2Step-3


DEFINITIONS
The negation of a statement states the opposite of the given statement.


SOLUTION
(d) The opposite of a statement can be obtained by adding â€œnotâ€ to the given statement: The summer in Maine is not (hot and sunny).


(d) The summer in Maine is not (hot and sunny).
